title: Exfoliative cytologic method in the diagnosis of gastric cancer
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Cancer - Research
Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Medicine - Study and teaching
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Cervix uteri - Cancer - Diagnosis
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Medicine - Study and teaching
description: Shows how early diagnostic methods of detecting uterine and vaginal cancer in early 1940s have been applied to development of a technique using a gastric balloon to obtain tissue and blood samples to isolate gastric malignancy. Expert comment at conclusion suggests findings have been significant by this method.
